title: Needs-Based Foundational Programming Design

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: An introductory programming course for undergraduate students, offering a blended learning environment combining theoretical lectures with hands-on sessions, conducted primarily through practical exercises using digital devices (e.g., laptops)

learning_goals: Learners can recognize and explain the necessity of programming concepts in given problem scenarios
Learners can select appropriate programming structures to solve problems when abstraction levels change
Learners can write code that solves real-life problems by applying learned programming concepts

resources: IDE (Integrated Development Environment) for Programming Practice

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
